content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 8 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x,” and the heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is 2.9. f of x is 1.650. Column 2. x is 2.95. f of x is 1.625. Column 3. x is 2.99. f of x is 1.605. Column 4. x is 2.998. f of x is 1.601. Column 5. x is 3.002. f of x is 1.602. Column 6. x is 3.01. f of x is 1.612. Column 7. x is 3.05. f of x is 1.659. Column 8. x is 3.1. f of x is 1.716." overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>2.9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.95</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.99</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2.998</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.002</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.01</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.05</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3.1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>1.650</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.625</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.605</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.601</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.602</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.612</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.659</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1.716</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: The table above gives selected values for a function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Also shown is a portion of the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The graph consists of a line segment for <math alttext="x less than 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and part of a parabola for <math alttext="x greater than 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 3, of, f of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1.601 plus 1.602, and denominator 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.601</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1.602</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
